break-before-break-after-break-inside.name: multicol_context
break-before-break-after-break-inside.summary: The break-after CSS property sets how page, column, or region breaks should behave after a generated box. If there is no generated box, the property is ignored.
break-before-break-after-break-inside.title: break-after

break-before-break-after-break-inside.name: paged_context
break-before-break-after-break-inside.summary: The break-after CSS property sets how page, column, or region breaks should behave after a generated box. If there is no generated box, the property is ignored.
break-before-break-after-break-inside.title: break-after

break-before-break-after-break-inside.name: region_context
break-before-break-after-break-inside.summary: The break-after CSS property sets how page, column, or region breaks should behave after a generated box. If there is no generated box, the property is ignored.
break-before-break-after-break-inside.title: break-after

break-before-break-after-break-inside.name: multicol_context
break-before-break-after-break-inside.summary: The break-before CSS property sets how page, column, or region breaks should behave before a generated box. If there is no generated box, the property is ignored.
break-before-break-after-break-inside.title: break-before

break-before-break-after-break-inside.name: paged_context
break-before-break-after-break-inside.summary: The break-before CSS property sets how page, column, or region breaks should behave before a generated box. If there is no generated box, the property is ignored.
break-before-break-after-break-inside.title: break-before

break-before-break-after-break-inside.name: region_context
break-before-break-after-break-inside.summary: The break-before CSS property sets how page, column, or region breaks should behave before a generated box. If there is no generated box, the property is ignored.
break-before-break-after-break-inside.title: break-before

break-before-break-after-break-inside.name: multicol_context
break-before-break-after-break-inside.summary: The break-inside CSS property sets how page, column, or region breaks should behave inside a generated box. If there is no generated box, the property is ignored.
break-before-break-after-break-inside.title: break-inside

break-before-break-after-break-inside.name: paged_context
break-before-break-after-break-inside.summary: The break-inside CSS property sets how page, column, or region breaks should behave inside a generated box. If there is no generated box, the property is ignored.
break-before-break-after-break-inside.title: break-inside

break-before-break-after-break-inside.name: region_context
break-before-break-after-break-inside.summary: The break-inside CSS property sets how page, column, or region breaks should behave inside a generated box. If there is no generated box, the property is ignored.
break-before-break-after-break-inside.title: break-inside

cc.name: column-count
cc.summary: The column-count CSS property breaks an element's content into the specified number of columns.

firefox.notes: Prior to version 37, multiple columns didn't work with display: table-caption elements.

firefox_android.notes: Prior to version 37, multiple columns didn't work with display: table-caption elements.

cc.title: column-count

cf.name: column-fill
cf.summary: The column-fill CSS property controls how an element's contents are balanced when broken into columns.
cf.title: column-fill

column-gap.name: flex_context
column-gap.summary: The column-gap CSS property sets the size of the gap (gutter) between an element's columns.
column-gap.title: column-gap (grid-column-gap)

column-gap.name: grid_context
column-gap.summary: The column-gap CSS property sets the size of the gap (gutter) between an element's columns.
column-gap.title: column-gap (grid-column-gap)

column-gap.name: multicol_context
column-gap.summary: The column-gap CSS property sets the size of the gap (gutter) between an element's columns.

firefox.notes: Before Firefox 3, the default value for the normal keyword was 0 and not 1em.

column-gap.title: column-gap (grid-column-gap)

crc.name: column-rule-color
crc.summary: The column-rule-color CSS property sets the color of the line drawn between columns in a multi-column layout.
crc.title: column-rule-color

crs.name: column-rule-style
crs.summary: The column-rule-style CSS property sets the style of the line drawn between columns in a multi-column layout.
crs.title: column-rule-style

crw.name: column-rule-width
crw.summary: The column-rule-width CSS property sets the width of the line drawn between columns in a multi-column layout.
crw.title: column-rule-width

column-rule.name: column-rule
column-rule.summary: The column-rule shorthand CSS property sets the width, style, and color of the line drawn between columns in a multi-column layout.

firefox.notes: Before Firefox 3, the default value for the normal keyword was 0 and not 1em.

column-rule.title: column-rule

column-span.name: column-span
column-span.summary: The column-span CSS property makes it possible for an element to span across all columns when its value is set to all.
column-span.title: column-span

cw.name: column-width
cw.summary: The column-width CSS property sets the ideal column width in a multi-column layout.

firefox.notes: Prior to version 37, multiple columns didn't work with display: table-caption elements.

firefox_android.notes: Prior to version 37, multiple columns didn't work with display: table-caption elements.

cw.title: column-width

columns.name: columns
columns.summary: The columns CSS shorthand property sets the number of columns to use when drawing an element's contents, as well as those columns' widths.

firefox.notes: Prior to version 37, multiple columns didn't work with display: table-caption elements.

firefox_android.notes: Prior to version 37, multiple columns didn't work with display: table-caption elements.

columns.title: columns

filling-columns.name: widows
filling-columns.summary: The widows CSS property sets the minimum number of lines in a block container that must be shown at the top of a page, region, or column.
filling-columns.title: widows
